thread.title: Donald Trump shares stage with fan who prays to a cardboard cutout of him every day
thread.title_full: Donald Trump shares stage with fan who prays to a cardboard cutout of him every day

author: Dan Bloom
title: Donald Trump shares stage with fan who prays to a cardboard cutout of him every day
text:
Donald Trump shares stage with fan who prays to a cardboard cutout of him every day The superfan's depth of devotion to the US President became clear in a TV interview Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Donald Trump Brings Supporter On Stage At Rally In Melbourne Florida Share this video Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
Donald Trump has shared the stage with a fan who prays to a cardboard cutout of him every day. 
The President invited the delighted man on stage at a Florida rally last night - to the apparent annoyance of Secret Service agents - and proclaimed: "A star is born!". 
The man's depth of devotion to the US President later became clear in an interview with CNN. 
In a message to the Republican billionaire, he said: "I've been with you for two years. Every single second, every day, I'm with you." Read More 
The superfan then revealed: "I got a six foot cardboard box of President Trump in my house and I salute that every single day. 
"And I pray and tell him, Mr President, I pray for your safety today. (Photo: Getty) Donald Trump invited the superfan on stage declaring: "A star is born!" (Photo: Getty) 
"And I'm not lying, I do that every single day to the President that is cardboard." 
The man, named by CNN as Gene Huber, also implored the media to "be a little nicer to our President." 
The Republican returned to a campaign-style rally just weeks into his Presidency in a move that has raised eyebrows in Washington. (Photo: Getty) Air Force One rolled up to the doors of the aircraft hangar where Trump gave his speech (Photo: Barcroft) Comment Below 
The Washington Post suggested his three visits to Florida since January 20 - including to his ultra-expensive Mar-a-Lago resort - have cost US taxpayers Â£8m for security, travel and other costs. 
The Presidential jumbo jet Air Force One rolled up to the doors of the aircraft hangar where Trump gave his speech. 
That is despite Trump tweeting in 2014: "I say we cannot continue to let Obama fly around on Air Force 1, at a cost of millions of dollars a day, for the purpose of politics & play!" Like us on Facebook
